title: File Allocation Methods
subject: Operating Systems
theory:
How disk blocks are assigned.
1. **Contiguous**: Fast, fragmentation issues.
2. **Linked**: List of blocks. No random access.
3. **Indexed**: Index block holds pointers. (Inode). Standard.

interview_questions.question: What is an Inode in Unix?
interview_questions.answer: Data structure storing all file meta-data (except name) and block pointers.

real_world_use_cases.description: FAT uses linked list (FAT table). EXT4 uses Inodes.
